title: Investment trusts dust off a dowdy image
text:
Investment trusts dust off their dowdy image Judith Evans Comments ©iStock 
The insult still stings. Five years ago, Peter Hargreaves, founder of the fund supermarket Hargreaves Lansdown, told the Financial Times: “I do not think the investment trust industry is capable of being revived. It’s run by a lot of fuddy duddies who have no place in the industry.” 
The 142-year-old trusts sector responded defensively. One supporter admitted trusts had “as much charisma as a three-day-old haddock”, but insisted the sector was “more dynamic than its public persona would suggest”. Others produced performance data suggesting that the fuddy-duddies were in fact outperforming their open-ended cousins. More
